name: Simulate Protein Signaling Network
description: Simulate protein signaling network dynamics using ODE-based logic modeling with normalized Hill functions
install: cd /tmp && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/snap-stanford/Biomni.git biomni_repo && cd biomni_repo && pip install -e . && pip install numpy scipy

inputs.name: NETWORK_STRUCTURE
inputs.description: JSON dictionary defining network topology. Keys are target proteins, values are lists of [regulator, regulation_type] where type is 1 for activation, -1 for inhibition (format: {"ProteinB": [["ProteinA", 1]]})

inputs.name: REACTION_PARAMS
inputs.description: JSON dictionary of reaction parameters. Keys are [regulator, target] tuples, values are dicts with W (weight), n (Hill coefficient), and EC50 (format: {"[\"ProteinA\", \"ProteinB\"]": {"W": 1.0, "n": 2, "EC50": 0.5}})

inputs.name: SPECIES_PARAMS
inputs.description: JSON dictionary of species parameters. Keys are protein names, values are dicts with tau (time constant), y0 (initial concentration), and ymax (maximum concentration) (format: {"ProteinA": {"tau": 10, "y0": 0.1, "ymax": 1.0}})

inputs.name: SIMULATION_TIME
inputs.description: Total simulation time in arbitrary time units

inputs.name: TIME_POINTS
inputs.description: Number of time points for the simulation
